snippet: More than 50,000 children were the first students in the city’s expanded program, and many were delighted to take part.
abstract: More than 51,000 children attend their first day of prekindergarten in New York City, inaugurating vast and ambitious expansion of the program under Mayor Bill de Blasio; initiative is seen as a crucial test of de Blasio's young administration, which more than doubled the scope of prekindergarten in under eight months.

byline.original: By ELIZABETH A. HARRIS and KATE TAYLOR
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Kate Pastor, Kyle Spencer, Nikita Stewart and John Surico.

lead_paragraph: More than 50,000 children were the first students in the city’s expanded program, and many were delighted to take part.

headline.main: 51,000 Answer de Blasio’s Bell for New Pre-K
headline.print_headline: 51,000 Answer De Blasio’s Bell for New Pre-K
